data.text:
In the last couple of years, Horizon College & Seminary has launched numerous amazing and unique M.A. and B.A. programs. These can be completed in person or online.

We have students from BC to NS, but we are still waiting from some from NWT, Yukon, and Nunavut. These are programs like:

Master of Arts in Pastoral Counselling

Master of Arts in Ministry Leadership

Sisterhood Women’s Cohort

Horizon Plus, unique partnership programs (some available online) like

Bachelor of Arts in Media Ministry

Bachelor of Arts in Christian Studies and Health Services

Bachelor of Arts in Christian Studies and BioTechnology

And more…

Master of Arts in Pastoral Counselling

This 48 credit program can be completed in 2 to 10 years. It equips ministry leaders to serve as counsellors in a variety of ministry-based settings: local church, chaplaincy, non-profit organizations, or with their own practice.

Since it aims to integrate expertise in counselling with a biblical worldview, the program has a stronger foundation of biblical and theological studies than most graduate counselling programs.

The program is designed to help students meet the academic requirements for gaining professional recognition as a member of the Canadian Counselling and Psychotherapy Association and the Canadian Association for Spiritual Care.

Watch the MA in Pastoral Counselling introduction video here.

Master of Arts in Ministry Leadership

This 48 credit program can be completed in 2 to 10 years. It prepares competent Christian leaders for church, lay ministry, and other workplace roles by combining graduate-level leadership training, biblical and theological studies, and a specialized area of studies or specialized ministry apprenticeships.

Sisterhood Women’s Cohort (graduate studies only)

In partnership with Sisterhood Ministries Canada, Horizon is offering an innovative educational cohort that empowers women in ministry and everyday life to bring transformational change to their churches, communities, and world.

The women’s cohort provides a unique opportunity for women to study the bible, theology, and ministry leadership in a context of mutual encouragement and support. Participants will take four graduate courses together over a two-year period. Courses can be used toward the completion of a Graduate Certificate or one of Horizon’s MA programs.

Women who enter the program with the intention of using the degree for professional or lay ministry, and who demonstrate a financial need, can apply for a bursary of $500.00 for each cohort course from Horizon College & Seminary.

Watch the Sisterhood Women’s Cohort introduction video here.

Horizon Plus, unique BA partnership Programs (some available online)

I know of no programs like these in Canada.

Students will receive Christian formation and leadership training as well as training in a focused area such as

Practical Nursing,

Computer Systems Technology,

Continuing Care Assistant,

Mental Health and Addictions Counselling,

Business Studies,

and many other options.

In these 3 and 4-year programs, students graduate with both a bachelor’s degree from Horizon and a Diploma or Certificate from either Saskatchewan Polytechnic and the Edwards School of Business of the University of Saskatchewan. Or, students might choose to combine studies at Horizon with studies from another community college across Canada.

Depending on the area of focus that the students choose, they will graduate from Horizon with one of these degrees:

BA or BTh in Media Ministry

BA in Christian Studies and Health Services

BA in Christian Studies and BioTechnology

BA or BTh in Mental Health and Addictions Ministry

BA in Christian Studies and Applied Technology

BA in Christian Studies and Office Administration

BA in Christian Studies and Support Services

BA in Christian Studies and Industrial Arts

BA Christian and Business Studies

BA or BTh Entrepreneurial Ministry

New College Scholarships (Undergraduate Only)

Horizon has several college scholarships available and have recently added 2 NEW scholarships for new full-time students:

Emerging Leader Scholarship, 1600.00 Applied to account

Available to new Horizon undergraduate students (Canadian Residents only), including transfer students, who have demonstrated leadership in any setting, such as school, church, camp, or employment.

Service-Based Scholarship, $1600.00 Applied to account

Available to new Horizon undergraduate students (Canadian Residents only), including transfer students, who have served in any setting, such as school, church, camp, or employment.

Visit Horizon.edu for more information.
